intro: Distictis granulosa, commonly known as the granulate distictis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive granular texture, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
